intro: Radicula officinalis, commonly known as the medicinal root, is a perennial herb native to temperate regions. It features a fibrous root system that is the primary part used in traditional medicine. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and small, greenish flowers. Its roots are harvested in the fall and are known for their medicinal properties. The botanical classification places it within the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs.
